flags.alt: The flag of Grenada features a large central rectangular area surrounded by a red border, with three five-pointed yellow stars centered on the top and bottom borders. The central rectangle is divided diagonally into four alternating triangular areas of yellow at the top and bottom and green on the hoist and fly sides, and a five-pointed yellow star on a red circle is superimposed at its center. A symbolic nutmeg pod is situated on the green hoist-side triangle.

nationalAnthem.title: Hail Grenada
nationalAnthem.info: Adopted as the national anthem in 1974 after independence.

countryHistory: Denmark is one of the oldest continuous monarchies in the world, with roots dating back to the Viking Age. It became a constitutional monarchy in 1849, and over time has evolved into a modern welfare state. Denmark is a founding member of NATO and the European Union, though it does not use the euro.

flags.alt: The flag of Cameroon is composed of three equal vertical bands of green, red and yellow, with a yellow five-pointed star in the center.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Cameroon
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Cameroon is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Cameroon gained independence from France and the United Kingdom on January 1, 1960. The country has experienced periods of political instability and civil unrest, but it remains an influential country in Central Africa. Its economy is driven by agriculture, oil, and mining, and Cameroon serves as a regional economic hub.

flags.alt: The flag of Guinea is composed of three equal vertical bands of red, yellow and green.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Guinea
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Guinea is currently unavailable.

centralBank: Central Bank of the Republic of Guinea
countryHistory: Guinea gained independence from France on October 2, 1958. The country has experienced periods of political instability, including a military coup in 2008. Its economy is heavily dependent on mining, particularly bauxite, as well as agriculture. Guinea is one of the worldâ€™s leading producers of bauxite and has vast mineral resources.

flags.alt: The flag of Bahrain has a red field. On the hoist side, it features a white vertical band that spans about one-third the width of the field and is separated from the rest of the field by five adjoining fly-side pointing white isosceles triangles that serve as a serrated line.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Bahrain
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Bahrain is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Bahrain gained independence from the United Kingdom on August 15, 1971. The country has since transformed from a small trading center into a modern financial hub. Bahrain is one of the wealthiest countries in the Middle East, with its economy driven by oil, finance, and banking sectors.

flags.alt: The flag of Suriname is composed of five horizontal bands of green, white, red, white and green in the ratio of 2:1:4:1:2. A large five-pointed yellow star is centered in the red band.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Suriname
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Suriname is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Suriname gained independence from the Netherlands on November 25, 1975. The country has a rich cultural heritage, influenced by African, Asian, and European traditions. Its economy is based on natural resources, including gold, oil, and agriculture, with a growing focus on sustainable development and diversification.

flags.alt: The flag of the Democratic Republic of the Congo has a sky-blue field with a yellow-edged red diagonal band that extends from the lower hoist-side corner to the upper fly-side corner of the field. A large five-pointed yellow star is situated above the diagonal band on the upper hoist side of the field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of DR Congo
nationalAnthem.eng: The national anthem of DR Congo
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of DR Congo is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: The Democratic Republic of the Congo gained independence from Belgium on June 30, 1960. It has experienced significant political instability, including civil wars and dictatorial rule. The country is rich in natural resources, particularly minerals, and is considered one of the most resource-rich nations in Africa.

flags.alt: The flag of Somalia features a large five-pointed white star centered on a light blue field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Somalia
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Somalia is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Somalia gained independence on July 1, 1960, through the union of the British Somaliland Protectorate and the Italian Somaliland. The country has faced significant political instability and civil war, leading to the collapse of the central government in 1991. Somalia has since worked towards rebuilding and stabilizing its political institutions.

flags.alt: The flag of Czechia is composed of two equal horizontal bands of white and red, with a blue isosceles triangle superimposed on the hoist side of the field. The triangle has its base on the hoist end and spans about two-fifth the width of the field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Czechia
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Czechia is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Czechia, also known as the Czech Republic, became an independent nation on January 1, 1993, following the peaceful dissolution of Czechoslovakia. It has a history of being part of several empires, including the Austro-Hungarian Empire, and later under Soviet influence as part of Czechoslovakia. Since independence, Czechia has developed into a stable democratic republic and a member of the European Union and NATO.

flags.alt: The flag of Vanuatu is composed of two equal horizontal bands of red and green, with a black isosceles triangle superimposed on the hoist side of the field. This triangle has its base on the hoist end, spans about two-fifth the width of the field and is enclosed on its sides by the arms of a thin black-edged yellow horizontally oriented Y-shaped band which extends along the boundary of the red and green bands to the fly end of the field. A yellow boar's tusk encircling two yellow crossed namele leaves is centered in the triangle.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Vanuatu
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Vanuatu is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Vanuatu gained independence from France and the United Kingdom on July 30, 1980. The country is composed of a group of islands in the South Pacific, known for its volcanic origins and rich cultural diversity. Vanuatu has a mixed economy, relying on agriculture, tourism, and offshore finance.

flags.alt: The flag of Togo is composed of five equal horizontal bands of green alternating with yellow. A red square bearing a five-pointed white star is superimposed in the canton.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Togo
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Togo is currently unavailable.

centralBank: Central Bank of West African States
countryHistory: Togo gained independence from France on April 27, 1960. It has since experienced periods of political stability under a single-party rule, followed by multi-party democracy. Togo's economy is driven by agriculture, particularly cotton and cocoa, and its location as a regional trade hub has contributed to its growth.

flags.alt: The flag of Kenya is composed of three equal horizontal bands of black, red with white top and bottom edges, and green. An emblem comprising a red, black and white Maasai shield covering two crossed white spears is superimposed at the center of the field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Kenya
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Kenya is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Kenya gained independence from the United Kingdom on December 12, 1963. The country has a rich history, with diverse ethnic groups and cultures. It has experienced periods of political instability but has remained a major economic hub in East Africa, with a growing economy driven by agriculture, services, and industry.

flags.alt: The flag of Rwanda is composed of three horizontal bands of light blue, yellow and green. The light blue band is twice the height of the other two bands and bears a yellow sun with twenty-four rays on its fly side.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Rwanda
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Rwanda is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Rwanda gained independence from Belgium on July 1, 1962. The country experienced a tragic genocide in 1994, resulting in the deaths of over 800,000 people. Since then, Rwanda has made significant progress in terms of economic growth, political stability, and social development, becoming one of Africa's fastest-growing economies.

flags.alt: The flag of Estonia is composed of three equal horizontal bands of blue, black and white.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Estonia
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Estonia is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Estonia gained independence from the Russian Empire on February 24, 1918. The country was later occupied by the Soviet Union during World War II and regained independence on August 20, 1991, following the collapse of the Soviet Union. Estonia is known for its digital advancements and is a leader in e-governance.

flags.alt: The flag of Romania is composed of three equal vertical bands of navy blue, yellow and red.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Romania
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Romania is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Romania gained independence from the Ottoman Empire on May 9, 1877. The country underwent significant political changes, including the establishment of a communist regime after World War II. Romania transitioned to a democratic republic in 1989 after the fall of the communist regime. It became a member of the European Union in 2007.

flags.alt: The flag of Trinidad and Tobago has a red field with a white-edged black diagonal band that extends from the upper hoist-side corner to the lower fly-side corner of the field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Trinidad and Tobago
nationalAnthem.eng: The national anthem of Trinidad and Tobago
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Trinidad and Tobago is currently unavailable.

centralBank: Central Bank of Trinidad and Tobago
countryHistory: Trinidad and Tobago gained independence from the United Kingdom on August 31, 1962. The country became a republic on August 1, 1976. It has a rich cultural heritage influenced by African, Indian, and European traditions. Known for its oil and gas industries, Trinidad and Tobago is one of the most developed nations in the Caribbean.

flags.alt: The flag of Guyana has a green field with two isosceles triangles which share a common base on the hoist end. The smaller black-edged red triangle spanning half the width of the field is superimposed on the larger white-edged yellow triangle which spans the full width of the field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Guyana
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Guyana is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Guyana gained independence from the United Kingdom on May 26, 1966. It became a republic in 1970. The country has a history of political and ethnic tensions but has made significant progress in its democratic governance. Guyana is known for its natural resources, including gold, bauxite, and oil, and its growing economy, especially due to recent oil discoveries.

flags.alt: The flag of Timor-Leste has a red field with two isosceles triangles which share a common base on the hoist end. The smaller black triangle, which bears a five-pointed white star at its center and spans one-third the width of the field, is superimposed on the larger yellow triangle that extends to the center of the field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Timor-Leste
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Timor-Leste is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Timor-Leste gained independence from Indonesia on May 20, 2002, following a referendum in 1999, where the majority of the population voted for independence. Timor-Leste was a former Portuguese colony, and its history has been marked by a long struggle for self-determination. Since independence, the country has focused on rebuilding its infrastructure and economy.

flags.alt: The flag of Vietnam features a large five-pointed yellow star on a red field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Vietnam
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Vietnam is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Vietnam gained independence from France on September 2, 1945, following the First Indochina War. The country was divided into North and South Vietnam until the Vietnam War ended in 1975, resulting in the reunification of the country under communist rule. Vietnam has since undergone significant economic reforms, becoming one of the fastest-growing economies in Southeast Asia.

flags.alt: The flag of Uruguay is composed of nine equal horizontal bands of white alternating with blue, with a white square superimposed in the canton. In the white square is a yellow sun bearing a human face â€” the Sun of May â€” from which sixteen rays extend. The sun's rays alternate between triangular and wavy.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Uruguay
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Uruguay is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Uruguay gained independence from Brazil on August 25, 1825. It was later recognized as an independent nation in 1828. Uruguay has a stable democracy and a strong tradition of social welfare, which has positioned it as one of the most progressive countries in Latin America. It is known for its advanced education system, progressive policies, and high standard of living.

flags.alt: The flag of Vatican City is square shaped. It is composed of two equal vertical bands of yellow and white, with national coat of arms centered in the white band. The national coat of arms comprises the Papal Tiara superimposed on two crossed keys.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Vatican City
nationalAnthem.eng: The national anthem of Vatican City
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Vatican City is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Vatican City is the smallest country in the world, both in terms of area and population. It became an independent state on February 11, 1929, with the Lateran Treaty between the Holy See and Italy. Vatican City serves as the spiritual and administrative center of the Roman Catholic Church, and it is governed by the Pope.

flags.alt: The flag of Austria is composed of three equal horizontal bands of red, white and red.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Austria
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Austria is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Austria became an independent republic after the collapse of the Austro-Hungarian Empire in 1918. The country was annexed by Nazi Germany in 1938 and regained independence after World War II. Austria is known for its cultural heritage, particularly in music, and its role in European politics and diplomacy.

flags.alt: The flag of Antigua and Barbuda has a red field with an inverted isosceles triangle based on the top edge and spanning the height of the field. This triangle has three horizontal bands of black, light blue and white, with the light blue band half the height of the two other bands. The top half of a golden-yellow sun is situated in the lower two-third of the black band to depict a rising sun.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Antigua and Barbuda
nationalAnthem.eng: The national anthem of Antigua and Barbuda
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Antigua and Barbuda is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Antigua and Barbuda gained independence from the United Kingdom on November 1, 1981. The country has a history of being part of the British colonial empire, and after independence, it became a member of the Commonwealth of Nations. Antigua and Barbuda is known for its tourism industry and beautiful beaches.

flags.alt: The flag of Turkmenistan has a green field. It features a red vertical band, bearing five carpet guls stacked above two crossed olive branches, near the hoist end of the field. Just to the fly side of the vertical band near the top edge of the field is a hoist-side facing white crescent and five small five-pointed white stars placed just outside the crescent opening.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Turkmenistan
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Turkmenistan is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Turkmenistan gained independence from the Soviet Union on December 25, 1991. After independence, it was ruled by President Saparmurat Niyazov, who established an authoritarian regime. The country is rich in natural gas reserves and has a centralized, state-controlled economy. Turkmenistan has been focusing on maintaining a neutral foreign policy and promoting economic development.

flags.alt: The flag of Mozambique is composed of three equal horizontal bands of teal, black with white top and bottom edges, and yellow. A red isosceles triangle spanning about two-fifth the width of the field is superimposed on the hoist side with its base on the hoist end. This triangle bears a crossed rifle and hoe in black superimposed on an open white book which is superimposed on a five-pointed yellow star.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Mozambique
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Mozambique is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Mozambique gained independence from Portugal on June 25, 1975, following a prolonged liberation struggle led by the Mozambique Liberation Front (FRELIMO). The country underwent a civil war from 1977 to 1992, which ended with a peace agreement. Mozambique has since focused on rebuilding its economy, primarily relying on agriculture, natural resources, and tourism.

flags.alt: The flag of Panama is composed of four equal rectangular areas â€” a white rectangular area with a blue five-pointed star at its center, a red rectangular area, a white rectangular area with a red five-pointed star at its center, and a blue rectangular area â€” in the upper hoist side, upper fly side, lower fly side and lower hoist side respectively.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Panama
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Panama is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Panama gained independence from Colombia on November 3, 1903, with the support of the United States, which also helped to construct the Panama Canal. The canal, completed in 1914, played a key role in the country's economic development. Panama is known for its financial services, banking sector, and as a global logistics hub due to the canal.

flags.alt: The flag of Micronesia has a light blue field, at the center of which are four five-pointed white stars arranged in the shape of a diamond.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Micronesia
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Micronesia is currently unavailable.

centralBank: Federated States of Micronesia Development Bank
countryHistory: Micronesia gained independence from the United States on November 3, 1986, through the Compact of Free Association. Prior to that, it was a part of the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands under U.S. administration. The country consists of four states: Yap, Chuuk, Pohnpei, and Kosrae, and has a mixed economy with agriculture, fishing, and services as major contributors.

chambers.name: Congress of the Federated States of Micronesia

flags.alt: The flag of Ireland is composed of three equal vertical bands of green, white and orange.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Ireland
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Ireland is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Ireland gained independence from the United Kingdom in 1922, following the Anglo-Irish Treaty and the Irish War of Independence. It became a republic in 1949. Ireland has a rich cultural history, particularly in literature and the arts, and has grown into one of Europe's wealthier nations, known for its technology and pharmaceutical industries.

chambers.elected_by: Combination of direct election and appointments

flags.alt: The flag of Norway has a red field with a large white-edged navy blue cross that extends to the edges of the field. The vertical part of this cross is offset towards the hoist side.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Norway
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Norway is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Norway was part of the union with Denmark until 1814, when it entered into a union with Sweden. Norway gained full independence from Sweden on June 7, 1905. The country has a long history of political stability and has become one of the wealthiest nations in the world, with significant oil reserves and a strong welfare state.

flags.alt: The flag of Central African Republic is composed of four equal horizontal bands of blue, white, green and yellow intersected at the center by a vertical red band of equal size as the horizontal bands. A yellow five-pointed star is situated on the hoist side of the blue band.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Central African Republic
nationalAnthem.eng: The national anthem of Central African Republic
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Central African Republic is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: The Central African Republic gained independence from France on August 13, 1960. The country has experienced periods of political instability, with several coups and civil conflicts. Despite its rich natural resources, including diamonds, timber, and gold, the Central African Republic remains one of the poorest countries in the world.

flags.alt: The flag of Burkina Faso features two equal horizontal bands of red and green, with a yellow five-pointed star in the center.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Burkina Faso
nationalAnthem.eng: The national anthem of Burkina Faso
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Burkina Faso is currently unavailable.

centralBank: Central Bank of West African States
countryHistory: Burkina Faso gained independence from France on August 5, 1960. The country has a history of political instability, including military coups and periods of authoritarian rule. Despite these challenges, Burkina Faso is known for its agricultural sector, particularly in cotton production, and has been focused on development and reducing poverty.

flags.alt: The flag of Eritrea comprises three triangles â€” a large red isosceles triangle with its base spanning the hoist end and its apex at the midpoint on the fly end, and a green and blue right-angled triangle above and beneath the red triangle. On the hoist side of the red triangle is a golden vertical olive branch encircled by a golden olive wreath.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Eritrea
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Eritrea is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Eritrea gained independence from Ethiopia after a 30-year armed struggle, culminating in 1991 with the end of the Ethiopian Civil War. Eritrea formally became an independent nation in 1993 following a UN-supervised referendum. Despite its independence, Eritrea has faced ongoing political and economic challenges, including a long-standing border conflict with Ethiopia.

flags.alt: The flag of Tanzania features a yellow-edged black diagonal band that extends from the lower hoist-side corner to the upper fly-side corner of the field. Above and beneath this band are a green and light blue triangle respectively.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Tanzania
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Tanzania is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Tanzania was formed in 1964 through the union of Tanganyika and Zanzibar. Tanganyika had gained independence from the United Kingdom in 1961, while Zanzibar gained independence from the British in 1963. Tanzania has had a history of political stability and has been a major player in East Africa. The country is known for its rich wildlife, including the Serengeti and Mount Kilimanjaro.

flags.alt: The flag of South Korea has a white field, at the center of which is a red and blue Taegeuk circle surrounded by four black trigrams, one in each corner.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of South Korea
nationalAnthem.eng: The national anthem of South Korea
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of South Korea is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: South Korea was established in 1948 following the end of Japanese rule over Korea and the subsequent division of the Korean Peninsula into North and South. The Korean War (1950-1953) resulted in a ceasefire, but no peace treaty was signed. South Korea has grown into a major economic power with a highly developed infrastructure, advanced technology, and a global cultural influence.

flags.alt: The flag of Jordan is composed of three equal horizontal bands of black, white and green, with a red isosceles triangle superimposed on the hoist side of the field. This triangle has its base on the hoist end, spans about half the width of the field and bears a small seven-pointed white star at its center.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Jordan
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Jordan is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Jordan gained independence from the United Kingdom on May 25, 1946. Initially, it was known as the Emirate of Transjordan, later becoming the Kingdom of Jordan. The country has faced regional instability, but it has remained a relatively stable state in the Middle East, maintaining a key role in regional politics and peace efforts.

flags.alt: The flag of Mauritania has a green field with a thin red horizontal band at the top and bottom of the field. At the center of the field is a five-pointed yellow star above an upward facing yellow crescent.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Mauritania
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Mauritania is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Mauritania gained independence from France on November 28, 1960. The country has experienced periods of political instability, including military coups. Despite its vast deserts and limited natural resources, Mauritania has significant mineral reserves and is an important exporter of iron ore. The nation also has a strong agricultural sector based on livestock and fishing.

flags.alt: The flag of Lithuania is composed of three equal horizontal bands of yellow, green and red.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Lithuania
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Lithuania is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Lithuania declared independence from the Russian Empire on February 16, 1918, but was occupied by the Soviet Union in 1940. It regained its independence on March 11, 1990, becoming the first Soviet republic to declare independence. Lithuania is a member of the European Union and NATO and has experienced rapid economic growth since independence.

flags.alt: The flag of Slovakia is composed of three equal horizontal bands of white, blue and red. The coat of arms of Slovakia is superimposed at the center of the field slightly towards the hoist side.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Slovakia
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Slovakia is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Slovakia was part of Czechoslovakia until it peacefully separated on January 1, 1993, forming the independent Slovak Republic. It has since become a member of the European Union, NATO, and the eurozone. Slovakia has undergone significant economic transformation, focusing on high-tech industries, manufacturing, and services.

flags.alt: The flag of Angola features two equal horizontal bands of red and black, with a yellow emblem at its centre. This emblem consists of a five-pointed star within the hoist-side facing half of a cogwheel that is crossed on its lower end by a machete.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Angola
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Angola is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Angola gained independence from Portugal on November 11, 1975, after a protracted struggle that included a civil war. The country has vast natural resources, including oil and diamonds, and has made significant progress in reconstruction following the end of the civil war in 2002. Despite challenges, Angola remains one of the fastest-growing economies in Africa.

flags.alt: The flag of Kazakhstan has a turquoise field, at the center of which is a gold sun with thirty-two rays above a soaring golden steppe eagle. A thin vertical band displays a national ornamental pattern â€” koshkar-muiz â€” in gold near the hoist end.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Kazakhstan
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Kazakhstan is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Kazakhstan gained independence from the Soviet Union on December 16, 1991. It is the world's largest landlocked country and the ninth largest by land area. Kazakhstan has vast mineral and energy resources and plays a significant role in Central Asia's economy and geopolitics.

flags.alt: The flag of Moldova is composed of three equal vertical bands of blue, yellow and red, with the national coat of arms centered in the yellow band.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Moldova
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Moldova is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Moldova gained independence from the Soviet Union on August 27, 1991. It has a complex political history, with tensions between its pro-European and pro-Russian factions. Despite economic challenges, Moldova has pursued closer ties with the European Union and has undergone significant reforms in recent years.

flags.alt: The flag of Mali is composed of three equal vertical bands of green, yellow and red.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Mali
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Mali is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Mali gained independence from France on September 22, 1960. Following its independence, the country went through periods of political instability, including military coups. Despite these challenges, Mali remains a significant player in West Africa, with a rich history rooted in the ancient empires of Ghana, Mali, and Songhai.

flags.alt: The flag of Armenia is composed of three equal horizontal bands of red, blue and orange.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Armenia
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Armenia is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Armenia declared independence from the Soviet Union on September 21, 1991. It has a rich cultural and historical heritage, with its origins dating back to ancient times. Armenia has faced conflicts, most notably the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict with Azerbaijan, but continues to work on its economic and political development while seeking closer ties with international organizations.

flags.alt: The flag of Samoa has a red field. A blue rectangle, bearing a representation of the Southern Cross made up of five large and one smaller five-pointed white stars, is superimposed in the canton.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Samoa
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Samoa is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Samoa gained independence from New Zealand on January 1, 1962, becoming the first Polynesian country to achieve independence. It has a rich cultural heritage and has undergone significant political and economic reforms since independence, focusing on sustainable development and regional cooperation.

flags.alt: The flag of Japan features a crimson-red circle at the center of a white field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Japan
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Japan is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Japan's history dates back thousands of years, with the country becoming a major global power during the Meiji Restoration in the late 19th century. After World War II, Japan adopted a pacifist constitution and became an economic powerhouse, known for its technological advancements and global influence in various industries.

chambers.name: House of Councillors
chambers.elected_by: Proportional representation and single non-transferable vote

flags.alt: The flag of Bolivia is composed of three equal horizontal bands of red, yellow and green, with the national coat of arms centered in the yellow band.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Bolivia
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Bolivia is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Bolivia gained independence from Spain on August 6, 1825. The country has a diverse cultural heritage and is rich in natural resources, including gas and minerals. Bolivia has faced periods of political instability but has made strides toward democratic governance and economic development in recent decades.

flags.alt: The flag of Chile is composed of two equal horizontal bands of white and red, with a blue square of the same height as the white band superimposed in the canton. A white five-pointed star is centered in the blue square.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Chile
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Chile is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Chile gained independence from Spain on February 12, 1818. The country has a strong cultural and political history, with a democratic government, though it experienced a military dictatorship from 1973 to 1990. Today, Chile is known for its stable economy, democratic governance, and significant role in the Latin American region.

flags.alt: The flag of the United States of America is composed of thirteen equal horizontal bands of red alternating with white. A blue rectangle, bearing fifty small five-pointed white stars arranged in nine rows where rows of six stars alternate with rows of five stars, is superimposed in the canton.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of United States
nationalAnthem.eng: The national anthem of United States
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of United States is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: The United States declared independence from Great Britain on July 4, 1776. It became a global superpower, with significant influence in politics, economics, culture, and military affairs. The U.S. has undergone periods of social and political change, including civil rights movements, and remains a key player in global affairs.

flags.alt: The flag of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines is composed of three vertical bands of blue, gold and green. The gold band is twice as wide as the other two bands and bears three green diamonds arranged to form the letter V at its center.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
nationalAnthem.eng: The national anthem of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines gained independence from the United Kingdom on October 27, 1979. The country has a rich cultural heritage and relies heavily on agriculture, particularly bananas, and tourism. It is part of the Caribbean's Lesser Antilles and has maintained a stable political environment since independence.

flags.alt: The flag of Seychelles is composed of five broadening oblique bands of blue, yellow, red, white and green, which extend from the hoist side of the bottom edge to the top and fly edges of the field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Seychelles
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Seychelles is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Seychelles gained independence from the United Kingdom on June 29, 1976. The country has a diverse cultural heritage and relies heavily on tourism and fishing as its main economic activities. Seychelles has focused on maintaining environmental sustainability and has one of the highest per capita incomes in Africa.

flags.alt: The flag of Guatemala is composed of three equal vertical bands of light blue, white and light blue, with the national coat of arms centered in the white band.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Guatemala
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Guatemala is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Guatemala gained independence from Spain on September 15, 1821. It has a rich indigenous heritage and a history marked by periods of political instability and civil conflict. In recent years, Guatemala has worked to strengthen its democratic institutions, although challenges such as poverty and corruption remain significant.

flags.alt: The flag of Ecuador is composed of the horizontal bands of yellow, blue and red, with the yellow band twice the height of the other two bands. The Ecuadorian coat of arms is superimposed in the center of the field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Ecuador
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Ecuador is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Ecuador gained independence from Spain on August 10, 1809, and officially became independent on May 24, 1822. The country has a diverse geography ranging from the Amazon rainforest to the Andes mountains. Ecuador has faced political instability at various points in its history, but it remains a significant player in Latin America with a strong economy based on oil exports, agriculture, and tourism.

flags.alt: The flag of Tajikistan is composed of three horizontal bands of red, white and green in the ratio of 2:3:2. A golden-yellow crown surmounted by an arc of seven five-pointed golden-yellow stars is centered in the white band.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Tajikistan
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Tajikistan is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Tajikistan gained independence from the Soviet Union on September 9, 1991. The country has a rich Persian cultural heritage and is known for its mountainous terrain. Tajikistan faced a civil war after independence but has since worked toward political stability under the leadership of Emomali Rahmon.

flags.alt: The flag of Malta is composed of two equal vertical bands of white and red. A representation of the George cross edged in red is situated on the upper hoist-side corner of the white band.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Malta
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Malta is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Malta gained independence from the United Kingdom on September 21, 1964, and became a republic on December 13, 1974. Malta has a rich history dating back to ancient times and has played a strategic role in the Mediterranean. It joined the European Union in 2004 and has developed into a hub for finance, tourism, and information technology.

flags.alt: The flag of Gambia is composed of three equal horizontal bands of red, blue with white top and bottom edges, and green.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Gambia
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Gambia is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Gambia gained independence from the United Kingdom on February 18, 1965. It is the smallest country on the African mainland, with a history marked by its role in the transatlantic slave trade and British colonial rule. Since independence, Gambia has experienced periods of political instability, but it has maintained a democratic system since the 2016 election.

flags.alt: The flag of Nigeria is composed of three equal vertical bands of green, white and green.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Nigeria
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Nigeria is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Nigeria gained independence from the United Kingdom on October 1, 1960. It is the most populous country in Africa and has a rich cultural diversity with over 250 ethnic groups. Nigeria has a history of military and civilian governments, with the most recent democratic transition occurring in 1999. The country is a leading oil producer and plays a significant role in both regional and global affairs.

flags.alt: The flag of the Bahamas is composed of three equal horizontal bands of aquamarine, yellow and aquamarine, with a black equilateral triangle superimposed on the hoist side of the field. This triangle has its base on the hoist end and spans about one-third the width of the field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Bahamas
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Bahamas is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: The Bahamas gained independence from the United Kingdom on July 10, 1973. The country is an archipelago of over 700 islands and cays, known for its tourism industry and status as a financial hub. The Bahamas has maintained political stability with a strong tradition of democratic governance.

flags.alt: The flag of Kuwait is composed of three equal horizontal bands of green, white and red, with a black trapezium superimposed on the hoist side of the field. This trapezium has its base on the hoist end and spans about one-fourth the width of the field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Kuwait
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Kuwait is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Kuwait gained independence from the United Kingdom on June 19, 1961. The country has a rich history of trade and is one of the wealthiest nations due to its vast oil reserves. Kuwait underwent a period of instability during the Gulf War in 1990-1991, but it has since recovered and remains a key player in the Middle East.

flags.alt: The flag of Maldives has a red field, at the center of which is a large green rectangle bearing a fly-side facing white crescent.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Maldives
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Maldives is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: The Maldives gained independence from the United Kingdom on July 26, 1965. The country is an archipelago of 1,192 coral islands grouped in 26 atolls in the Indian Ocean. The Maldives has a history of political stability, although it has experienced periods of authoritarian rule. It transitioned to a multi-party democracy in 2008, with a focus on tourism and marine industries.

flags.alt: The flag of South Sudan is composed of three equal horizontal bands of black, red with white top and bottom edges, and green. A blue equilateral triangle which spans about two-fifth the width of the field is superimposed on the hoist side with its base on the hoist end of the field. At the center of this triangle is a five-pointed yellow star.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of South Sudan
nationalAnthem.eng: The national anthem of South Sudan
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of South Sudan is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: South Sudan gained independence from Sudan on July 9, 2011, after decades of civil war. It is the youngest country in the world. Despite its independence, South Sudan has faced internal conflict and instability, which has hindered development. The country has significant oil reserves but struggles with political and economic challenges.

flags.alt: The flag of Iran is composed of three equal horizontal bands of green, white and red. A red emblem of Iran is centered in the white band and Arabic inscriptions in white span the bottom edge of the green band and the top edge of the red band.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Iran
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Iran is currently unavailable.

centralBank: Central Bank of the Islamic Republic of Iran
countryHistory: Iran, formerly known as Persia, gained independence from foreign powers after the 1979 Islamic Revolution, which overthrew the monarchy and established an Islamic Republic. Iran has a rich history and cultural heritage, and it plays a key geopolitical role in the Middle East. The country has faced international sanctions and political tensions but remains a significant regional power.

flags.alt: The flag of Albania features a silhouetted double-headed black eagle at the center of a red field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Albania
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Albania is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Albania gained independence from the Ottoman Empire on November 28, 1912. The country has a rich history, having undergone periods of monarchy, communism, and democratic reforms. Albania transitioned from a communist regime to a multi-party democracy in the early 1990s and has since worked on strengthening its economy and political institutions.

flags.alt: The flag of Brazil has a green field with a large yellow rhombus in the center. Within the rhombus is a dark blue globe with twenty-seven small five-pointed white stars depicting a starry sky and a thin white convex horizontal band inscribed with the national motto 'Ordem e Progresso' across its center.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Brazil
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Brazil is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Brazil gained independence from Portugal on September 7, 1822. It became a republic in 1889 and is the largest country in South America. Brazil has a rich cultural heritage and a diverse economy, with significant agricultural, industrial, and technological sectors. It has faced periods of military dictatorship and political instability, but has remained a key regional power.

flags.alt: The flag of Serbia is composed of three equal horizontal bands of red, blue and white. The coat of arms of Serbia is superimposed at the center of the field slightly towards the hoist side.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Serbia
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Serbia is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Serbia gained independence from the Ottoman Empire in the 19th century and later became part of Yugoslavia. After the breakup of Yugoslavia in the 1990s, Serbia formed a union with Montenegro, which ended in 2006. Serbia has faced challenges with economic development and political reforms but remains a key player in the Balkans.

flags.alt: The flag of Belize has a royal blue field with a thin red horizontal band at the top and bottom of the field and the national coat of arms in the center.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Belize
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Belize is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Belize gained independence from the United Kingdom on September 21, 1981. It is a small country located on the eastern coast of Central America, known for its diverse culture, rich history, and stunning natural resources, including the Belize Barrier Reef.

chambers.name: Senate
chambers.elected_by: Appointments made by the Prime Minister and the Leader of the Opposition

name.official: Republic of the Union of Myanmar

flags.alt: The flag of Myanmar is composed of three equal horizontal bands of yellow, green and red, with a large five-pointed white star superimposed at the center of the field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Myanmar
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Myanmar is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Myanmar, formerly known as Burma, gained independence from the United Kingdom on January 4, 1948. The country has faced significant political and ethnic conflicts over the years, including military rule, and is currently under a military-led government following a coup in February 2021.

flags.alt: The flag of Bhutan is divided diagonally, from the lower hoist-side corner to the upper fly-side corner, into an upper yellow and a lower orange triangle. A fly-side facing white dragon holding four jewels in its claws is situated along the boundary of the two triangles.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Bhutan
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Bhutan is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Bhutan, located in the Eastern Himalayas, became a unified kingdom in the 17th century. It gained full independence from British suzerainty in 1949. The country transitioned from an absolute monarchy to a constitutional monarchy in 2008, following the introduction of democratic reforms.

flags.alt: The flag of Venezuela is composed of three equal horizontal bands of yellow, blue and red. At the center of the blue band are eight five-pointed white stars arranged in a horizontal arc.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Venezuela
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Venezuela is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Venezuela gained independence from Spain on July 5, 1811. It was a founding member of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) and has one of the largest oil reserves in the world. The country has faced significant political and economic turmoil in recent decades, marked by hyperinflation, a humanitarian crisis, and a political struggle for power.

flags.alt: The flag of Liberia is composed of eleven equal horizontal bands of red alternating with white. A blue square bearing a five-pointed white star is superimposed in the canton.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Liberia
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Liberia is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Liberia was founded by freed American slaves in 1847 and became the first African republic to declare independence. The country has experienced periods of political instability and civil war, but it has made strides towards recovery since the end of the second civil war in 2003.

flags.alt: The flag of Jamaica is divided by a gold diagonal cross into four alternating triangular areas of green at the top and bottom, and black on the hoist and fly sides

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Jamaica
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Jamaica is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Jamaica gained independence from the United Kingdom on August 6, 1962. It is an island nation in the Caribbean known for its rich culture, vibrant music scene, and strong tourism industry. Jamaica has a history shaped by slavery, colonialism, and struggles for independence.

chambers.name: Senate
chambers.elected_by: Appointments made by the Governor-General on the advice of the Prime Minister and the Leader of the Opposition

flags.alt: The flag of Poland is composed of two equal horizontal bands of white and red.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Poland
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Poland is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Poland's history is marked by its position at the crossroads of Europe. It regained independence in 1918 after more than a century of partitions. The country fell under communist rule after World War II but transitioned to democracy in 1989. Poland joined the European Union in 2004 and has since become one of the fastest-growing economies in Europe.

name.official: Nation of Brunei, Abode of Peace

flags.alt: The flag of Brunei has a yellow field with two adjoining diagonal bands of white and black that extend from the upper hoist side of the field to the lower fly side. The red emblem of Brunei is centered on the field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Brunei
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Brunei is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Brunei gained full independence from the United Kingdom on January 1, 1984. The small Southeast Asian nation has a rich history as a powerful sultanate in the region, with a wealth derived largely from its vast oil and natural gas reserves.

chambers.name: Legislative Council
chambers.elected_by: Appointed by the Sultan and the Prime Minister

flags.alt: The flag of Comoros is composed of four equal horizontal bands of yellow, white, red and blue, with a green isosceles triangle superimposed on the hoist side of the field. This triangle has its base on the hoist end, spans about two-fifth the width of the field and bears a fly-side facing white crescent and four five-pointed white stars arranged in a vertical line along the opening of the crescent.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Comoros
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Comoros is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: The Comoros gained independence from France on July 6, 1975. The archipelago, located off the east coast of Africa, has experienced political instability, with several coups and power struggles since independence.

flags.alt: The flag of Tonga has a red field. A white rectangle bearing a red Greek cross is superimposed in the canton.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Tonga
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Tonga is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Tonga is the only Polynesian kingdom and remained a British protectorate until it gained full independence on June 4, 1970. The country has a rich cultural heritage and is known for its monarchy, which has maintained a unique status in the Pacific region.

chambers.name: House of Lords
chambers.elected_by: Appointed by the King and the nobility

name.official: Independent and Sovereign Republic of Kiribati

eng.official: Independent and Sovereign Republic of Kiribati

flags.alt: The flag of Kiribati is divided into two halves. While the upper half has a red field, at the center of which is a yellow frigate bird flying over the top half of a rising yellow sun with seventeen visible rays, the lower half is composed of six horizontal wavy bands of white alternating with blue to depict the ocean.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Kiribati
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Kiribati is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Kiribati gained independence from the United Kingdom on July 12, 1979. The island nation, located in the central Pacific Ocean, is known for its vast exclusive economic zone and faces significant challenges from climate change due to rising sea levels.

flags.alt: The flag of Ghana is composed of three equal horizontal bands of red, gold and green, with a five-pointed black star centered in the gold band.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Ghana
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Ghana is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Ghana became the first sub-Saharan African country to gain independence from colonial rule on March 6, 1957, from the United Kingdom. The country has a rich history, with its role in the transatlantic slave trade and its post-independence development marked by political changes, military coups, and a transition to democracy in the 1990s.

flags.alt: The flag of Chad is composed of three equal vertical bands of blue, gold and red.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Chad
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Chad is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Chad gained independence from France on August 11, 1960. The country has experienced long periods of instability, marked by civil wars and a history of authoritarian rule. Despite its challenges, Chad is a key player in Central Africa with strategic importance and natural resources, including oil.

flags.alt: The flag of Zimbabwe is composed of seven equal horizontal bands of green, yellow, red, black, red, yellow and green, with a white isosceles triangle superimposed on the hoist side of the field. This triangle is edged in black, spans about one-fourth the width of the field and has its base on the hoist end. A yellow Zimbabwe bird superimposed on a five-pointed red star is centered in the triangle.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Zimbabwe
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Zimbabwe is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Zimbabwe, formerly known as Southern Rhodesia, gained independence from the United Kingdom on April 18, 1980. The country has had a tumultuous history, including a period of political instability, economic challenges, and hyperinflation in the 2000s. Zimbabwe is known for its rich mineral resources, especially gold and diamonds.

flags.alt: The flag of Mongolia is composed of three equal vertical bands of red, blue and red, with the national emblem â€” the Soyombo â€” in gold centered in the hoist-side red band.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Mongolia
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Mongolia is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Mongolia declared its independence from China in 1911 and formally recognized its sovereignty in 1945 after a period of Soviet influence. It transitioned to a multi-party democracy in 1990 following the collapse of the Soviet Union, and has since grown as a landlocked, mineral-rich nation in East Asia.

flags.alt: The flag of Portugal is composed of two vertical bands of green and red in the ratio of 2:3, with the coat of arms of Portugal centered over the two-color boundary.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Portugal
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Portugal is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Portugal became an independent kingdom in 1139, and it played a leading role in the Age of Exploration. The country established a vast colonial empire that lasted until the mid-20th century. It became a republic in 1910 and later joined the European Union in 1986, experiencing a period of modernization and economic growth.

flags.alt: The flag of the Republic of the Congo features a yellow diagonal band that extends from the lower hoist-side corner to the upper fly-side corner of the field. Above and beneath this band are a green and red triangle respectively.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Republic of the Congo
nationalAnthem.eng: The national anthem of Republic of the Congo
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Republic of the Congo is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: The Republic of the Congo gained independence from France on August 15, 1960. It has experienced political instability, including a civil war in the 1990s, and has since made progress towards economic development, driven largely by its oil and natural resources.

flags.alt: The flag of Belgium is composed of three equal vertical bands of black, yellow and red.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Belgium
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Belgium is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Belgium gained independence from the Netherlands on October 4, 1830. The country played a significant role in European politics, both during its colonial period and in modern times as a founding member of the European Union. Belgium has experienced linguistic and regional tensions between Dutch-speaking Flanders, French-speaking Wallonia, and the German-speaking community.

flags.alt: The flag of Israel has a white field with a blue hexagram â€” the Magen David â€” centered between two equal horizontal blue bands situated near the top and bottom edges of the field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Israel
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Israel is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Israel was established on May 14, 1948, as a Jewish state in the Middle East. The country has a complex history, marked by conflicts with neighboring Arab countries, the ongoing Israeli-Palestinian conflict, and its significant role in regional and global politics.

flags.alt: The flag of New Zealand has a dark blue field with the flag of the United Kingdom â€” the Union Jack â€” in the canton and a representation of the Southern Cross constellation, made up of four five-pointed white-edged red stars, on the fly side of the field.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of New Zealand
nationalAnthem.eng: The national anthem of New Zealand
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of New Zealand is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: New Zealand became a British colony in 1840 through the Treaty of Waitangi and gained full sovereignty in 1947. The country has a rich indigenous Maori culture and has become known for its natural beauty, progressive social policies, and strong agricultural and tourism industries.

flags.alt: The flag of Nicaragua is composed of three equal horizontal bands of blue, white and blue, with the national coat of arms centered in the white band.

nationalAnthem.title: National Anthem of Nicaragua
nationalAnthem.info: Information about the national anthem of Nicaragua is currently unavailable.

countryHistory: Nicaragua gained independence from Spain on September 15, 1821. The country has a history of political instability, including civil wars and U.S. intervention in the 20th century. Despite its challenges, Nicaragua remains the largest country in Central America and has significant agricultural and natural resources.
